item.title: 中国财政部响应习近平呼吁在中国人民银行进行债券交易
item.description: 中国财政部表示支持允许央行交易政府债券，重申了习近平主席的一句话，这句话点燃了市场对货币策略改变的猜测。【原文：China’s Ministry of Finance said it supports allowing the central bank to trade government bonds, reaffirming a sentence from President Xi Jinping that ignited market speculation about a change of monetary strategy.】

item.title: 黄金 (XAUUSD) 在创下近两年来最大单日跌幅后再度下跌
item.description: 中东地缘政治风险的减弱抑制了避险需求，投资者也在关注美联储不会很快降息的信号，黄金在创下近两年来最大盘中跌幅后再次下跌。【原文：Gold fell again after its biggest intraday loss in almost two years, with subsiding geopolitical risks in the Middle East crimping haven demand and investors monitoring signals the Federal Reserve won’t soon cut rates.】

item.title: First Sentier 因收费过低关闭 90 亿美元基金并裁员
item.description: 澳大利亚基金管理公司 First Sentier Investors 周二宣布，计划关闭四只基金，总金额达 140 亿澳元（约合 90 亿美元），以退出低利润业务线。【原文：Australian fund manager First Sentier Investors plans to close four funds totaling A$14 billion ($9 billion) in a retreat from low-margin business lines, it announced Tuesday.】

item.title: 随着产量的增加，北极星公司的黄金销售量也随之增加
item.description: 由于贵金属价格接近历史最高水平，澳大利亚矿商北极星资源有限公司（Northern Star Resources Ltd.）预计本季度黄金销售量将 "大幅增加"，原因是包括超级矿坑（Super Pit）在内的卡尔古利（Kalgoorlie）矿场产量增加、品位提高。【原文：Australian miner Northern Star Resources Ltd. expects to “significantly increase” gold sales this quarter on higher production and better grades from its Kalgoorlie operations, including the Super Pit, as prices for the precious metal trade near record levels.】

item.title: 瑞银上调中国股票评级至增持，下调台湾和韩国股票评级
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）将中国和香港股票的评级上调至增持，理由是尽管中国的房地产和宏观经济令人担忧，但其盈利仍具有弹性。【原文：UBS Group AG lifted China and Hong Kong stocks to overweight, citing resilient earnings despite the nation’s property and macro worries.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。特斯拉在繁忙的美国财报周发布财报。印度期权策略引发法庭闹剧。风险平价基金失去光泽。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Tesla reports during busy US earnings week. Indian options strategy stirs courtroom drama. Risk-parity funds lose luster. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 中东局势升级风险减弱，石油保持小幅下跌
item.description: 由于以色列和伊朗在上周针锋相对的互袭之后敌对行动大幅升级的风险有所缓解，石油价格保持小幅下跌。【原文：Oil held a modest decline as the risk of a significant escalation of hostilities between Israel and Iran eased following a tit-for-tat exchange of attacks last week.】

item.title: 泡沫红茶制造商茶百道在 2024 年香港最大 IPO 后首次亮相
item.description: 四川白茶百道实业股份有限公司（又名茶百道）将于周二首次上市交易，以测试市场对生产大受欢迎的泡沫红茶的公司股票的需求。【原文：Sichuan Baicha Baidao Industrial Co., also know as Chabaidao, is set to make its trading debut Tuesday, testing demand for shares of companies making hugely popular bubble tea.】

item.title: 对冲基金抢购日本利率交易员押注东山再起
item.description: 日本政府债券市场在经历了近十年的可预测性后出现了颠覆性的变化，这引发了利率交易员从银行流向对冲基金，他们有望获得更高的薪酬。【原文：The upending of Japan’s government bond markets after almost a decade of predictability has sparked a flow of rates traders from banks to hedge funds offering the prospect of much higher pay.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因利润乐观而追随美国股市反弹：市场综述
item.description: 在美国股市从2万亿美元的大跌中反弹之后，亚洲股市准备跟随华尔街同业走高，因为市场乐观地认为大型科技领军企业将在本周公布丰厚的利润。【原文：Asian stocks were poised to follow their Wall Street peers higher after US shares rebounded from a $2 trillion selloff on optimism big tech leaders will announce hefty profits this week.】

item.title: 中国镍业亿万富翁助推澳大利亚矿商在印尼发展
item.description: 一家名不见经传的澳大利亚公司正在成为中国镍业巨头在西方的代言人。【原文：A little-known Australian company is becoming the Western face of a Chinese nickel behemoth.】

item.title: 新加坡通过新提案提醒公司董事注意
item.description: 新加坡交易所（Singapore Exchange Ltd.）正在提议修改规则，使股东更容易召集特别股东大会，这是该城市国家正在进行的改善公司治理运动的最新举措。【原文：Singapore Exchange Ltd. is proposing a rule change that would make it easier for shareholders to call special general meetings, the latest in an ongoing campaign to improve corporate governance in the city-state.】

item.title: 韩国影子银行压力向全球投资者发出警告
item.description: 在价值 63 万亿美元的影子银行世界中，韩国正在成为一个受到密切关注的薄弱环节。【原文：South Korea is emerging as a closely watched weak link in the $63 trillion world of shadow banking.】

item.title: 迈阿密机场债券评级因航班需求旺盛而上调
item.description: 迈阿密国际机场的信用评级周一被S&P全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）上调一级至A+，此前人口激增推动了南佛罗里达州的航班需求。【原文：Miami International Airport has its credit rating raised one notch to A+ by S&P Global Ratings on Monday, after a population boom fueled demand for flights from South Florida.】

item.title: 购物中心巨头联手重振破产零售租户
item.description: 快递公司（Express Inc. 是最新一家准备从破产灰烬中崛起的零售商，其房东不可能将其收入囊中。【原文：Express Inc. is the latest retailer poised to rise from the ashes of bankruptcy in the unlikely hands of its landlords.】

item.title: 旧金山复苏缓慢，S&P 信用评级面临风险
item.description: 根据 S&P 全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）的数据，旧金山从大流行病中恢复的速度缓慢，加上预算支出不断增加，有可能导致该市偿还债务的能力下降。【原文：San Francisco’s sluggish recovery from the pandemic, coupled with growing budgetary expenditures, threatens to deteriorate the city’s ability to repay its debt, according to S&P Global Ratings.】

item.title: ADM 称前首席财务官 Luthar 将在会计调查后辞职
item.description: Archer-Daniels-Midland 公司称，前首席财务官 Vikram Luthar 已同意从 9 月 30 日起辞职。【原文：Archer-Daniels-Midland Co. said former Chief Financial Officer Vikram Luthar, who was placed on leave earlier this year pending on internal accounting probe, has agreed to resign effective Sept. 30.】

item.title: 摩根大通的科拉诺维奇称美股 "修正 "尚未结束
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：The slide in US equities over the past three weeks was the start of a selloff that is likely to deepen along with mounting macroeconomic risks, including rising Treasury yields, a strong dollar and elevated oil prices, says JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Marko Kolanovic.】

item.title: 加密货币基金第二周资金外流显示对 ETF 的胃口减弱
item.description: 据CoinShares International Ltd.的一份报告显示，由于投资者担心利率不会很快下降，全球加密货币基金的资金流出量在第二周继续下降。【原文：Appetite for global crypto funds continued to decline after a second week of outflows amid investor concerns that interest rates won’t be coming down any time soon, according to a report from CoinShares International Ltd.】

item.title: 美国人艾伦说，稳定币法案对消费者来说是 "巨大的灾难
item.description: 美国国会稳定币立法旨在使主要由法定货币支持的稳定币合法化，并对其许多方面进行澄清，该立法正引起加密货币行业的欢呼和传统金融界的批评。【原文：As Congressional stablecoin legislation designed to legitimize and clarify many aspects of the mostly fiat-backed coins moves along, it’s drawing cheers from the crypto industry — and criticism from the traditional finance world.】

item.title: 阿根廷石油钻探商 PAE 向投资者推介全球债券交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿根廷最大的原油出口商之一泛美能源公司本周将与投资者会面，以评估全球债券销售的需求。【原文：Pan American Energy, one of Argentina’s largest crude exporters, is meeting with investors this week to gauge demand for a global bond sale, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 提供 "100%"下行保护的新股票 ETF 即将推出
item.description: 这听起来像是为股票投资者打防守反击的稳赚不赔的交易：ETF 将在股市不下跌的情况下下注。【原文：It sounds like a surefire, slam-dunk trade for stock investors playing defense: ETFs that will bet on equity markets without — the pitch says — going down.】

item.title: 贝莱德的 Rieder 认为美联储今年有可能两次降息
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc）的里克-里德尔（Rick Rieder）表示，面对过去一个月收益率的痛苦上涨，债券投资者可能很快就会从通胀消退和美联储那里得到缓解。【原文：Bond investors confronting a painful run-up in yields in the past month may soon find relief from ebbing inflation and the Federal Reserve, according to BlackRock Inc.’s Rick Rieder.】

item.title: 以色列与伊朗紧张局势有缓和迹象，黄金矿业股回落
item.description: 由于以色列和伊朗之间的地缘政治紧张局势有缓和迹象，金银价格下跌，金矿股遭遇了两个月来最糟糕的交易时段。【原文：Gold mining stocks are suffering their worst trading session in two months as the price of bullion drops amid signs of easing geopolitical tensions between Israel and Iran.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会因在加密货币案件中滥用职权而受到谴责，两名律师辞职
item.description: 两名美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）律师在一名联邦法官制裁并严厉斥责华尔街监管机构在一起加密货币案件中 "严重滥用 "权力后辞职。【原文：Two Securities and Exchange Commission lawyers resigned after a federal judge sanctioned and sharply rebuked the Wall Street regulator for “gross abuse” of power in a crypto case.】

item.title: BC Partners 的 iQera 与顾问合作修复资产负债表
item.description: 收债公司 iQera Group SAS 及其股东和顾问正在评估各种资本结构方案，该公司在周一发布的一份报告中称。【原文：Debt collector iQera Group SAS — along with its shareholders and advisers — is evaluating various options for its capital structure, the company said in a report published Monday.】

item.title: 史密斯菲尔德公司因美国猪肉业务改善而利润大增
item.description: 美国史密斯菲尔德食品公司（Smithfield Foods）的所有者WH集团有限公司（WH Group Ltd.—）第一季度利润增长，原因是美国业务的 "大幅改善 "抵消了中国本土业务的下滑。【原文：WH Group Ltd. — the owner of US-based Smithfield Foods — saw profits rise in the first quarter as a “substantial improvement” in its US operations more than offset a decline in homeland China.】
